Description: Fragment of a faience Queen oinochoe, with Greek inscription. Glazed both inside and out. Glaze colour typical Ptolemaic bluey green, lifted off in places. At bottom of fragment projecting ridge with rectangular profile, from a depixction of an altar. An inscription is part of the altar, the reconstructed text in Greek is TUXHS ARSINOHS = 'Of the Good fortune of Arsinoe'. Jug used in the cult of Arsinoe II, after her death.
Curator's comments: The reconstruction of the inscription, the identification of the vessel, its dating and relation to the cult of the deified Arsinoe II is discussed in full by Dorothy Burr Thompson (Thompson 1973, no 145, p. 173, pl.L). Thompson, D. B. 1973. Ptolemaic Oinochoai and Portraits in Faience, Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.01)
